Posts.Content: Thank you for reply, group seems very supportive already.  Ive had several biopsies in the past which have all been the fibroademonas. I had a huge one removed, simply due to size. He never said which was why I’m worried. In the past, luckily seen same doc lots, he always seemed positive and would say to try not to worry, was sure was fibroademona etc. This time he said nothing. Before ultrasound he said, if biopsy required I’d have to go back for it as very very busy, then when found he changed his mind very quickly. First tried to drain fluid with needle but was nothing to drain. He just had no positivity in him at all this time.  How are you doing after your radiotherapy?
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: Thank you for talking to me. I will be sure to update with my results xxx Stay strong
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying. I’m sorry you’re having to go through all of this. I think your choice of how you told your kids was a good one. I think I would maybe have done the same. It’s my daughters birthday on Friday coming. I kind of don’t want to know until after her birthday as if it’s bad news I’m worried I’ll wallow in self pity. As selfish as that sounds.  Stay strong and thanks again x
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: Thank you very much.  I will absolutely as you and others have been so kind to talk with me. Xx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: So I had my biopsy done on Tuesday past. It’s not the first one I’ve had, but this is different and my symptoms are different. I’d like to hear about what took you to the breast clinic? My current visit was due to pain in my breast, crusty sort of nipple, shoulder and upper back pain, then on ultrasound a lump was found that I hadn’t felt. I’m terrified, but I guess I just have to wait.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms

Posts.Content: Thank you for reply.  She said that if everything was fine I’ll get a letter and if not a call to come back. Probably 7-10 days after. I’m terrified every time my phone rings.  I see your point about weird luck. I’m glad you found the first one. How long have you been diagnosed and how do you and family cope. I’m 37, husband, son who’s 17 and daughter almost 7.  Lilly
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Symptoms
